etymology.interpretation: Although the original pictorial representation of 癸 is unclear, it belongs to the class of characters known as pictograms, typically representing physical objects or abstract ideas. In ancient Chinese cosmology, 癸 is part of the Ten Heavenly Stems used in the traditional calendar system. Its visual form might have symbolized some aspect related to those applications.

examples.chinese: 在甲骨文中，癸常用于日期和方位的标记。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiǎgǔwén zhōng, guǐ cháng yòng yú rìqī hé fāngwèi de biāojì.
examples.english: In oracle bone script, 癸 was often used as a marker for dates and directions.

examples.chinese: 古书中癸通常与十天干的其他字符一起使用。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ shū zhōng guǐ tōngcháng yǔ shí tiāngān de qítā zìfú yīqǐ shǐyòng.
examples.english: In ancient texts, 癸 was typically used together with other characters of the Ten Heavenly Stems.
